title:
Quantitative uniform exponential acceleration of averages along decaying
  waves
abstract:
In this study, utilizing a specific exponential weighting function, we
investigate the uniform exponential convergence of weighted Birkhoff averages
along decaying waves and delve into several related variants. A key distinction
from traditional scenarios is evident here: despite reduced regularity in
observables, our method still maintains exponential convergence. In particular,
we develop new techniques that yield very precise rates of exponential
convergence, as evidenced by numerical simulations. Furthermore, this
innovative approach extends to quantitative analyses involving different
weighting functions employed by others, surpassing the limitations inherent in
prior research. It also enhances the exponential convergence rates of weighted
Birkhoff averages along quasi-periodic orbits via analytic observables. To the
best of our knowledge, this is the first result on the uniform exponential
acceleration beyond averages along quasi-periodic or almost periodic orbits,
particularly from a quantitative perspective.
